lines.text: Calm down, dear Nino. I don't understand this outburst. You've become highly irrational since that explosion in your laboratory. You lost your eye, your arm, your leg, your larynx. What's wrong with you?
And if there's one thing I've learned, in many many years of experience, it's that you cannot be too careful with your gun.
[puts his gun away in his pants, accidentally pulls the trigger]
Excuse me.
[turns around examines himself, turns back]
Are you al right?
Missed it by that much.

[Max and agent 34 crash into a roadblock with a sign showing skull and crossbones and a German warning]
Just our luck, we gotta run into a poisonous Achtung.
That means attention. There has been an avalanche.
Why, I once knew an agent who went into the Pentagon building in Washington, and was lost for three days!
Three days? I can't believe anyone could get that confused.
Well, let me see. I went in on a Tuesday...

[looking at a large door that works like a zipper]
That's the second biggest zipper I've ever seen!

[introducing Agent 22 to Agent 36]
36 - 22 - 36
Your bogus ingenuousness is straining my equanimity.
Could you put that another way?
You're pissing me off.
We're really up against it, this time, 86. The fate of the entire world is in your hands.
Oh no, not again. Well, ok this time, but next week I'm on vacation, Chief. If you get in trouble then, it's your ass.
You know, Chief, this nude bomb might solve a lot of problems.
Such as?
Well for one thing, flashers.
Only you would think of a that, Max.

That's why they pay me the big bucks. And there'd be no more trouble with concealed weapons. I mean if everyone was nude, there'd be no place to hide a gun or a knife. Well, there is a place, but it could be painful.
You're a legend, 86. When I was studying well the Spy Academy I reviewed every one of your cases.
Oh, well, wouldn't you like to hear my side of the story?
I think you're wonderful.
Oh, you have heard my side of the story.
Of course, the old bullet in the barrel trick.

[on hotline in limo]
Now you realize, Mr. Smart, that once KAOS learns your mission, they'll stop at nothing. You'll be in imminent danger, constant jeopardy, facing death at every turn.

[on other line in Control Cab]
And... loving it.
A stapler telephone? That's fantastic, Carruthers. Can it also be used as a stapler?
No.
Oh, well, you'd better work on that.
That girl worries me a lot, Chief. Whatever happened to the regulations regarding female agents? They're supposed to be unmarried, without dependence and willing to fool around a lot.
Of course, the old big black truck trick.
falling over backwards and coming up shooting. When did you first think of that?
The second my foot hit this banana peel.
Maxwell Smart is a fool and a bumbler.
So how do you explain how this bumbler has been able to thwart KAOS constanly in the past?
He's a lucky bumbler.
Max, I've been thinking about it. And if they decide to drop the nude bomb, I know the answer.

[Max does not reply]
Well?
Well what?
Don't you wanna know the answer?
No.
Food.
Food?
Sure, the whole world will start wearing food.

[on stapler phone]
Carruthers here. I am leaving the stapler location. I'll be at my piano number in half an hour. If you need me earlier, call me on my jock strap. But please, just ring once...
Of course! The old dashboard in the draw trick.
Look, 22, when I'm on a case, I don't fool around. I mean, before a case? Maybe. After a case? Definitely. During a case? Never.

[holding 36's bra in his lef hand]
22, I can explain this bra in 5 seconds.

[accidentally revealing 36's panties in his other hand]
Eh, these panties are gonna take a little longer.

[referring to Jonathan Levinson Seigle]
We have to ask him some questions.
He can't talk.
Can he type?

[Max is holding up his identification]
That doesn't look anything like you.
It's my thumb print.
22 was married to the late, great 78? Wasn't he a little old for her?

[hiding in Popular Spy magazine]
Well, let's see. 22 was 21 when she married 78 in '72. 78 was 46, that means 78 was 22, 32, 42, 25 years older than 22. 22 joined P.I.T.S when 78 died in 75.
Tell me, 13, how was 78 killed?
Investigating the numbers racket.

[to Max]
You're quite witty.
And charming.
There's something I think you should know, Maxwell.
And what is that?
Your ski's are on fire.

[referring to Jonathan Levinson Seigle]
He's too weak to talk, he's humming the information to us!
I'm a secret agent. And I am here on a very important mission, Edith. May I call you Edith?
I'd like that. Particularly since that's my name. You'll find I answer a lot faster to it than I would if you called me Marion.
I'm going to level with you, Marion... May I call you Marion?
I advise you to drop your guns an put up your hands.
Why?
Because at this very minute, my friend, this chalet is being completely surrounded by 500 alpine crack troops.
I find that hard to believe.
Would you believe 150 Tirolian ski-troops?
No we wouldn't.
How about 2 Saint Bernards in heat?

[having dropped the Chief off a bridge]
Sorry about that, Chief.
We've landed totally undetected, thanks to the my genius in creating the noiseless shush-copter.
Carruthers, radio our position to P.I.T.S. central. Tell them to send in the task force and to have them get here faster than possible.
[Carruthers leaves]
Al right, 22, we got to invade that zipper before the mountain's fly closes.
Instant cloning?
Yes. When I need them, there'll be a room full of Roses.
Well Mr Smart, evidently I underestimated you. You're not a complete fool after all. Almost, very close, but not complete.
Sorry about that... Normie.
Where's Sauvage?
He got hung up.
